meanings.definition: To scratch or grope around with one's fingers
meanings.sent1: The child scrabbled in the sand, searching for seashells.
meanings.sent2: The cat scrabbled at the door, trying to get outside.
meanings.sent3: The puppy scrabbled at the carpet, looking for a hidden toy.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel scrabbled up the tree trunk, trying to escape the dog.
meanings.sent5: The gardener scrabbled in the soil, planting new flowers.

meanings.sent1: The hiker scrabbled up the steep hill, determined to reach the top.
meanings.sent2: The mouse scrabbled to find a way out of the maze.
meanings.sent3: The student scrabbled to finish the test before the bell rang.
meanings.sent4: The climber scrabbled for a foothold on the rocky cliff.
meanings.sent5: The athlete scrabbled to recover after stumbling at the start of the race.

meanings.definition: To write or draw hastily and illegibly
meanings.sent1: The doctor scrabbled a quick note on the patient's chart.
meanings.sent2: The child scrabbled a messy drawing with crayons.
meanings.sent3: The journalist scrabbled down the key points of the interview.
meanings.sent4: The artist scrabbled a rough sketch before starting the painting.
meanings.sent5: The student scrabbled some last-minute notes before the exam.
